Key Match Events: Clemens made a game-saving catch with the bases loaded and two outs in the ninth inning on Sunday, slamming into the left-field wall to end the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Rob Thomson said the games following a postseason clincher can be nerve-wracking because the team is trying to avoid injuries before the playoffs.
Post-Match Reflections: Thomson mentioned that Castellanos becoming the first Phillies player to play every game in a season since Freddy Galvis in 2017 and the first to start 162 games in a season since Jimmy Rollins in '07 is something he's really proud of.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies will play the No. 3-seeded Brewers or the No. 6-seeded Mets/Diamondbacks in the NLDS.
The Phils had nothing to truly play for in Sunday afternoon's regular-season finale at Nationals Park, but their 6-3 victory over the Nationals gave them the second-best record in the Majors (95-67).
Others: Nola fell short of 200 innings, finishing with 199 1/3, but was okay after a scary moment when a line drive hit the right side of his lower back.
Hays did not play Saturday or Sunday because of a sore back, and it is unclear how he tweaked it.
